byline.contributor: David Montgomery contributed reporting from Austin, Tex.

lead_paragraph: The former governor was indicted by a grand jury in 2014 on two felony counts of coercing a public servant and abusing his power.

headline.print_headline: Texas Court Dismisses Case That Dogged Perry’s Presidential Campaign
headline.main: Texas Court Dismisses Criminal Case Against Rick Perry

snippet: The former governor was indicted by a grand jury in 2014 on two felony counts of coercing a public servant and abusing his power.
abstract: Texas's highest criminal court dismisses charges that Gov Rick Perry abused his power while in office in 2013 by threatening to cut funding to Austin's anticorruption unit unless District Atty Rosemary Lehmberg resigned; Perry argues verdict proves indictment was baseless political attack.
